titleInfo.title: Chet Atkins Interview Tape 1 of 2 Side Two

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame© and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Guitarist Chet Atkins recalls two of country music's best-known figures, Jim Reeves and Fred Rose. His discussion of Jim Reeves includes memories from his work with Reeves and comments on Reeve's international appeal and continuing popularity. His discussion of Fred Rose focuses on Rose's songwriting and song crafting techniques and includes the story behind "Chattanoogie Shoe Shine Boy." --Access restricted--

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
